DbFkP_28ZgWk9NKqGGhZzw.text: I was skeptical about trying this place out, since lately I've been experiencing poor ramen restaurants in the valley. However, this place is a very good comparison to Tompopo Ramen. It took about 5-10 minutes to find this place, since their store sign was not lit so I assumed there was not a business there. Upon entering the place, it is small and quaint. They give you water in a vase cylinder along with stainless steel cups. I was quite impressed by this, when comparing to other restaurants that don't do the same. I ordered the Shio Ramen, typically I order Spicy Miso but I wanted to change it up a bit. The Shio Ramen tasted very tender, clean, and has a slight fish taste. When ordering, the waitress will ask about your level of spiciness and the type of egg you want for you ramen. The menu is simple and easy to understand with not many menu items, so the kitchen can focus on what they do best.  This place is definitely a must try whenever you are in the area.

r78KVyT80NEHa0DXBjxE8w.text: Cute restaurant, fast and courteous service though it was full. Solid ramen and a perfectly cooked hard boiled egg  I tried the Black ramen but would go back to try others!

QWJaACJipYg_Q03k_Q-ZrA.text: It was pretty good if not a bit too salty. Also the egg was super hard boiled. I really like the soft boiled egg that I've always found comes in authentic ramen. But it was hot, and the portion was good.

2Pl6yB7zyqZYnm_Ep8FUQA.text: Finally, a legit ramen place in Phoenix. Came here for lunch the other day and got the traditional Tonkatsu Ramen and it was very good. The only reason I'm not giving the full 5 stars is because their soft boiled egg was really cold in the soup. Not sure if that's how its supposed to be, but it was a little weird. Other then that, I'm really glad this place is in Phoenix and I will definitely return for some ramen!

4tbh7fB_kRtqTy84ripW1Q.text: This might be the best ramen in Phoenix. The service is good. The menu is simple and easy to understand.  I've had the Tonkotsu, Miso, and Nishikawa Black ramen bowls so far. All at medium spice level. They were all decent but the Nishikawa Black had much stronger delicious flavors to me than the other bowls I've had so far.   The gyoza is decent and I do order it every time.  I've read minor complaints in other reviews about the 1 pork piece they have in the bowls of ramen. They are valid to me. Yes, it's a bit fatty and not packed with as much flavor as you're expecting. Yes, there's only 1 piece but I usually add an extra one for a small upcharge.  As someone else said, LA ramen is definitely better. However, this is still enjoyable and good enough for my ramen fix.  If you're not a ramen snob and are looking to try better ramen, go here. You will most likely enjoy it.

7fecGUA3xrc4lA-9elqBHA.text: Small shop with another, much bigger location in Chandler. This location had a cozy feel to it and our party of two was seated immediately at 1pm.  Started with the Chicken Karaage which we enjoyed. It had a reasonable portion size for the price.  Heavily disappointed by the Spicy Tonkotsu, the broth had an obvious lack of flavor compared to any other ramen spot I've been to.  This was made up for by the Nishikawa Black which I would certainly come back for. Definitely recommend getting curved noodles, but the pork chashu was pretty average.   Overall, a nice little spot for ramen, particularly due to its low price point. Will need to make a trip to the Chandler location as well.

V6b3KDWFM4MeBgACGPW64g.text: We had exceptional ramen here! Great portions and the server was very helpful with suggestions. It should be noted that as of the end of June they are still pending a liquor license. The description implied that beer & wine were available but that was not the case.

d0fVnZMCp6GAN9ZwewvvqA.text: The food was really good and filling. The food comes out pretty fast. Only thing that bugged me so much and killed the vibes was that the waitress keeper tossed the plates on the table like no caring, It was so rude plus she did it multiple times with our food.

NeTGb7UWV_GW7mAxDkEQrw.text: I was super bummed after our experience here. We walked in, sat. Got water right away. Sat for a while as it was decently busy... we had more than a desired amount of time to decide what we wanted while waiting for our server... 2 servers ran the floor, which you could see in its entirety from anywhere in the restaurant. We ordered everything together when our server came by. 3 apps, 2 beers and 3 ramens. (We wanted a bowl but they were out of rice) waited 15 minutes and got 1 of our apps... then the other 2 followed. Our beers finally came as 2 of the 3 ramens came. I assumed mine was following because the way everything else came out individually... our server never came back... I watched her stocking the cooler with soda and then stocking Togo containers and such. Multiple people came in for pickup orders but she never came back to our table... after my friends finished their meals we sat for an additional 15 minutes just waiting for our server to stop by but we noticed she was putting gloves on to go clean the bathroom. The other sever was cleaning a table near ours so I flagged her down (which is so annoying to do... it's so rude) I asked for the check as we were more than ready to go, I asked her to make sure that my ramen was not on there seeing as it never came and no one stopped by... you were all busy stocking for the night so I couldn't notify anyone... she said "oh I'm sorry you should've flagged me down".... hmmm maybe you should've stopped by seeing as your coworker was too busy with trying to leave... I never write reviews and this really bummed me out because I've been stoked to try this place... don't waste your time... just get takeout... Or honestly go to Sushiholic up the street (the service is awesome, the food rocks and the specials are killer)... The service here sucked which is lame because the ramen looked awesome. Moral of the story... skip it.

bvGm0mko3IL3FJVKKlZD3w.text: I'm a frequent visitor to the original Nishikawa location in Chandler...being addicted to the house Nishikawa Black Ramen. Today I ventured to the new central Phoenix location on a work outing. I must say that the quality didn't miss a beat. They pulled off the exact same high quality as always.  That being said, this place has earned my admiration and its time I take the time to honor them with my full opinion.  If you love Ramen or have never tried it (or only know of the instant packets--like me until I saw the Netflix Chef's Table episode on Ramen which put me on a mission to find a great place), just try this: go into Nishikawa (either here or their Chandler location), order the Nishikawa Black house soup and prepare yourself for an experience as good as the 20+ hour stewing broth and house-made noodles. The pork belly in the soup is melt-in-your mouth and I just love the soft-boiled eggs, the flavors are so deep and savory. The pot stickers are fantastic, served with some bright ponzu sauce. I also love the Takoyaki...fried-dough dumplings with octopus inside, covered in a sweet mayo sauce with shaved smoked fish. You will love these.  To sum it up, if there was a national competition of Ramen by city, let's say we'd want Nishikawa to be representing the Phoenix metro area. Tampopo in Tempe is a strong 2nd. But they are bit more expensive, lack a comfortable seating environment (you have to be in college to find it suitable) whereas Nishikawa offers comfort, and their overall Ramen flavor is a degree behind Nishikawa's (props to Tampopo for taking the time to make their own noodles in-house too and that is why they and Nishikawa tower above the other Ramen places around).

g5ObfTCxGwoH0PYj_JOMSQ.text: I'm from the SF/Bay Area and starving for good Asian food! The name of this place came in an email from Yelp, I looked at the reviews and decided to go there asap! I went with a friend, we both had ramen and a special agadashi tofu. The tofu was so good, not a lot of tofu around PHX/Scottsdale! It was really tasty! The ramen, well I can't say enough, it was SO good! I had a spicy miso ramen which was delish! My friend had a mild miso and she loved it as well. The service was really great, our waitress was wonderful! The place fills up quick, which tells you how good it is! I will return to see what else is on the menu. I am so happy to find legit ramen in PHX!

LWbCweZnqcFfvwkZoXMwWg.text: Amazing ramen! Food tasted great and was very authentic! Got the miso and potstickers and both were very tasty.

I come here for lunch at least once a week unless I'm out of town. They got the best ramen in Phoenix and the service is great even during busy lunch hours. If you are a first-timer or you're not sure what to order, they take the time to explain the menu and help you find what you're in the mood for. I highly recommend it. You got to give it a try!

oN7X62lmy1-y4dHcvegYgg.text: I love this place!  I visit this place anytime I am back in AZ.   Even has gluten free options for our daughter to enjoy.  Great food and service every time.

K7KcfTf7A2NeeOqJ2HHx4Q.text: Nishikawa is pretty good. Both my wife and I had the Nishikawa ramen. Big portion that filled us up. My wife had the spicy, and I had mild. It was legitimately spicy. I also liked the noodles, which were very soft. So why not 5 stars? We both thought the broth was slightly on the bland side. If it had a bit more flavor, we would probably have thought it was perfect.  Overall, a solid place for ramen.

5hV5uihu2Kk8nJg_aIx_1w.text: I have been here a few times. It's Good! It's a pretty small pace. Good Ramen. In Fact, all the items I have had on the menu have been good. I am a fan of the miso ramen, get your egg soft boiled.   Try the Katsu bowl. My kids love it. Juicy chicken cutlet, delightfully breaded over rice for about 6 bucks. It's a small portion perfect for the kids, or in the side with your soup.  Overall, the service is friendly and the couple of times I have been it has been average to above average. Last night was a little below average. Again, I want to talk service for a moment, food has been consistent and delicious.   It was a bit of a mess, it was 5:45 on a weekday and I was with a 3 year old. Two items that try your patience when going out.   We were the last party seated in a wave of folks arriving for dinner so I knew we were going to have to wait a little. Unfortunately it was a bit too much. 10 minutes to get out order taken, first the Katsu bowls showed up for the kids in about 10 minutes. Then our appetizer of edemame and finally, our soup. Overall we waited a solid 25 minutes from the time we ordered. Also, half our party was done with dinner by the time the rest of us even received ours. Not awesome.   It my opinion, they are just not staffed for the success they are having. If I'm not mistaken, 3 people ran the whole place, at the most 4! Two servers and a cook. I am no restauranteur but I don't think it is enough.   I estimate they were matching or exceeding their dining room guests with to-go guests. It seemed just too much for the staff on hand to take care of.    I don't want to burn the servers that were there either, they were doing pretty well for as busy as they were.   Niskikawa, I am going to give you 4 stars because I am going to rate all my experiences there in totality not just last night. Let's be clear, I want to have an awesome local Ramen place to enjoy but you are going to have to do better than this!  I will be back and hopefully will be able to keep those 4 stars.

oz6tn8tNW3wTcC3WdwWg4Q.text: This place for Ramen. Everything here has amazing flavor and plentiful amounts of toppings. The Nishikawa black is my fav. I mixed it up and asked for the veggie broth but with the black garlic truffle oil in it - omg. Also, takeout is well packaged and stays DELICIOUS!

bJID0vfAhPGcSaE8bGrd4A.text: I have been here multiple times. Never had bad service and the food is amazing. Hard to find good noodle places in Arizona but this is the top of the list.

yraHLsOsZGjuglUeVXmxcg.text: Not exactly excited with this place and probably will not go back.   The service was straight to the point, efficient, and without a whiff of friendliness or appreciation for our business.   The presentation was as good as the uploaded pictures, but the flavors were fairly lackluster in contrast.   We started with chicken karaage and pork gyoza. The gyoza was crisped nicely and was very flavorful, especially with the dipping sauce. The karaage and accompanying sauce was tasty, but the chicken thighs were full of connective tissue.    We finished with a pork bowl [with thinly sliced pork belly], vegetarian ramen and a Nishikawa Black ramen. I was able to taste all three and can say that none of the dishes were interesting. The pork belly and pork in the ramen carried some flavor, but the vegetarian and pork broths were bland and did not stick to the noodles like a full-bodied broth should. The noodles, however, were pleasingly chewy. I haven't had a ton of ramen broths in my life, but this stuff placed at the bottom of my list. To give you a sense of what I consider good pork broth, try making David Chang's pork ramen broth recipe. Maybe that's asking too much.   Again, we're probably not going to give this place a second try.

eW0mXxmHVhrjnGDXFuIXMw.text: Really solid ramen spot! I've been here twice and the ramen has been bursting with flavor, noodles perfectly cooked, nice soft boiled egg and delicious broth. I ventured out and have also tried the spicy salmon bowl and gyoza. The spicy salmon bowl is very fresh tasting and not too spicy where it overwhelms the whole dish. The gyoza are freshly made and have the telltale lace of proper gyoza, these are a must order! Service has always been good as well.

CYKjFD0z-s7Ri1yDrsi6QA.text: The ramen here is amazing. The flavors in the Nishikawa Black are out of this world. Perfectly cooked egg too. I love that they place the seaweed along the back of the bowl - both lovely and delish.  The only negative we had was that we also ordered the takoyaki for an appetizer. My friend had never had takoyaki and I really enjoyed mine at the Phoenix Night Market, so when our order was delivered, we dove in. Unfortunately, they were really cold in the middle. We alerted the server and decided against a replacement and they took it off the bill. This was not long after they had first opened their doors, so I'm hoping it was just a glitch in the matrix.   High quality ramen, high quality service. Can't wait to go again!

A6Tzsj3sUlFYbJbEXiS7kA.text: If you're looking for a great authentic Japanese food for sure dining in or take out would come here.  I've spent some time in Japan and would say that this location is just like being overseas for the quality of food.  The location is in a strip center but shouldn't deter you from the quality of what the food they have...  Check it out for yourself

zh6cNt73zgLLOgk5O_09YA.text: This was our first time trying ramen that didn't come in a packet. Really good! I also love the little tin cups and carafe of ice water with lemon they immediately bring you. Reasonable too, at ten bucks a person or so, and very filling. There were miso and a vegetarian option as well.

sBbnOE104nKGtyU6I41NnA.text: I came here on a very rainy, chilly day (which is unusual for an October day in Phoenix) so it was definitely a perfect time for ramen. I've had my fair share of disappointments with ramen in the Phoenix metro area, but I would say that I've finally found a pretty solid place. You know it's a good sign when the restaurant is full, even on a day where there were flash flood warnings everywhere. However, the wait was still reasonable (under 10 minutes) despite the initial 30 minute estimate. Service was average - speedy, but the servers seemed a little rushed and flustered.  The food was pretty darn good and hit the spot. We started the meal with the char siu bowl, which came with one piece of char siu over a bed of rice. It was good and well seasoned, but personally, this is one I'd skip especially if you're getting a bowl of ramen that comes with it anyway. So, I ordered the curry ramen while the wife had the tonkatsu. Both were tasty, although we both agreed that the curry was slightly better. Both ramen came with a big piece of char siu, a sheet of seaweed, and your choice of hard or soft boiled egg. I went with the soft boiled, and the yolk was cooked to perfection. Not too runny and not too overdone either. I enjoyed the noodles themselves as well - there was just enough firmness and kept its texture throughout the meal without being soggy. For Phoenix standards, this ramen is solid considering this isn't exactly a hotbed for Japanese food and culture.

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tonkatsu ramen (top) and curry ramen (bottom)

cFLdga1g3bqJl-7LgpfJhg.text: Traveling from NYC, I was very surprised to find such a good ramen place in Phoenix. In fact I think this place has the best ramen I've ever eaten. We stayed in Phoenix two nights and ate here twice. Definitely go for the one with the black garlic oil.

8Kb0k-hI6ZUKqWaao4Q4nw.text: My roommate and I came here for dinner last week because I was craving ramen and this place popped up on Yelp's trending list. We came about an hour before close and got seated very quickly. We had all of our questions about the menu answered and a large container of water and glasses were brought instantly to the table.   My roomie ordered edamame and one of the bowls and I ordered the kishikawa black ramen. When her bowl came out, it was shockingly small. I don't know if it came in a larger size or not but she was confused as to why it was so small and she was thankful that she ordered the edamame to help fill her up. We originally thought the bowl that came out was just the meat and veggies and that another bowl of rice was going to follow but nope it was all in there. I tried a little bit of her bowl and the meat was tender, had really good flavor, and wasn't overly salted. The edamame was pretty spicy which we liked. My ramen was good. I ordered it with a soft boiled egg and the egg was cooked perfectly. The broth was spicy and a little on the salty side but I actually enjoyed it a little saltier. In the ramen, they had sliced mushroom  and bamboo shoots as well as ground pork and pork chashu. I wish there were more crunchy components to the ramen. It had dried onion and dried seaweed but both of those get water logged with in a few seconds of being in the bowl.  Overall, it was a good dish though and it definitely hit the spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nishikawa black.
Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

R9tpVweiH88-XJ0rYFEn5A.text: Good ramen place in central Phoenix. Now I don't have to go so far to Tampopo. My favorite is the miso or curry ramen. Pork potstickers are great too. We order take out from here every now and then and it's always ready within 10 minutes.

fIOj7AltBOfcpFBNX_u-2w.text: Favorite ramen in AZ now has another location! Nishikawa Black has been a favorite flavor. Pork belly nearly breaks by chopstick. Would want more hot broth to eat it a little longer.

dZKuxRTdlq3LV-I0VNdhlg.text: The chicken karaggee was tasty, the ramen was decent to average. Felt like the ramen portions were small. I would return however wouldn't be my first choice.

xzIkvfvCz06DpZxqKXtGFg.text: Excellent ramen! We were visiting on vacation, and were in the mood for Ramen, and this place didn't disappoint.  We are Ramen snobs, having lived in NYC for a long time, so we usually have some healthy skepticism.  But man, what a treat!  The curry ramen was amazing.  I wish I would have asked if I can substitute a piece of pork katsu, because that would have been amazing...like katsu curry in a bowl!  My wife got the black ramen, and she loved it!  Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a good bowl of ramen.

Started with the chicken gyoza and was delicious. Then I had the cha siu ramen.  Would definitely go back!

ycfMPFWnsxil-bPdc_yuSg.text: Best ramen in the Phoenix area. We had the Tonkatsu, Veggie, and the Black specialty...they were all excellent. We added a little truffle oil to the veggie which made it a lot more rich. Will definitely go back again...soon!

AyhaHIpPGRDQkh5beRgbFw.text: Came to this place excited to try some new ramen! I usually go to the Noodle Bar and love their miso! This place is very small and was crammed when we got here. But that didn't bother me! The service was great, pork gyoza came out hot and was super yummy! Tried the spicy garlic edamame and man was it too much flavor! Didn't even finish the bowl. The miso ramen broth was so bland. I even ordered it "medium spicy" and it was still very bland. I had to add chili powder to give it flavor. The Kirin beer was really good tho! Probably wouldn't come back.

os3y85AsEhbq2CVKHWo_5w.text: It's not the best Ramen compared to some really good and authentic Ramen places in CA, but pretty decent in Phoenix. We had Nishikawa black, edemame, and takoyaki.

0SEUbm21hdV3gCpqgFe1pg.text: Let me just preface this by saying ramen is our hands down favorite food. Every time we visit a new city, ramen is the first thing we look for. Having just moved to Phoenix, we were on the hunt for our next favorite ramen joint. We had a few duds but we finally found this place. The food was so good here that we drive all the way from Goodyear to eat here when we need our fix. Their Tonkatsu Black bowl with mild spice and straight noodles is to die for and their soft boiled eggs are some of the best we have ever had. Also really enjoy the gyoza here. They have limited seating so plan on coming early but its well worth the wait! If you like authentic ramen, you will love this place!

HOQOuAXUlA3ZKZzmdEFhDg.text: Customer service was great! Counter girl was very helpful. I wasn't a huge fan of their ramen, however. I wasn't a huge fan of the broth, it was an overwhelming amount of garlic. I appreciated the aid of the employees, though, and may try a different ramen next time

yGlW9FpOUk3ONmzQ2WR3RA.text: I ordered the Tonkotsu which is their traditional pork broth based soup. It was about 10 bucks. The broth was very good. They claim to boil it for 20 hours which is legit. I don't consider myself a Ramen expert -- but I've had it from about half a dozen japanese restaurants. What I was disappointed with was the lack of traditional japanese ingredients. No seasoned bamboo, no bean sprouts or carrots, no spicy miso paste, no pickled red ginger. Very basic ingredients here -- just some green onion and mushroom strips. Finally, and probably most important, the egg was whole, overcooked and completely hard boiled -- not soft boiled and cut in half as it should be in Ramen.

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ArVEnDRwNRvUckklw9wMkA.text: A fun, casual ramen restaurant in Phoenix! There's a bunch of fun Japanese assortments on the table which shows the restaurant's attention to detail.   We started out with appetizers: the takoyaki, which is a round ball of octopus; chicken and ika geso karaage, which is pretty much fried chicken and squid legs. All of which were fantastic! If you're looking for something unique to try, keep the appetizers in mind.   Next, the ramen. There are a variety of ramen to choose from, with different broths, noodles, toppings, and fun add-ons. I ended up going with the curry ramen. The blend of spices and pork broth satisfied my craving for quality ramen. Definitely would come here again!

bzEnrxuMz26v2R-seZReGQ.text: Top - Miso Ramen Bottom - Tonkotsu Ramen  All the ramen is pork flavored ramen; there is one vegetarian option. You can make your Ramen mild, medium or spicy. The pork flavored ramen is very rich flavor.   Try the spicy garlic edamame. It is a little spicy if you're not into spicy food. My mouth is on fire but very good.   I would come here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dhJIX6icwti6jJcsWnEY_w.text: I was super excited when this place opened since it's within walking distance from my home. My bf and I went here for a date night and were pleasantly surprised with the pricing and the ramen. The seating is very limited, the tables are within very close proximity of one another and there are a few stools at a type of bar directly near the kitchen. The service was quick, waters were brought out immediately, which is almost never a thing in any restaurant I've ever been to. The ramen itself was EXCELLENT. I am a vegetarian so I tried the veggie ramen and my bf picked the pork belly ramen, he said it was the best thing he's ever eaten. We also got the garlic edamame, it was a bit of a small portion for the price, and came out cold. That is the only reason I am giving them 4 stars. Will definitely go again for ramen!

DvaVOPBnrsv4g4hjw2_4EA.text: **4.25**  Came here on a Friday night.  Not too busy, bit of a drive from Gilbert. Seated promptly.   Food: Miso ramen: Pork broth, pork chashu, green onions, menma, Seasoned egg, curved noodles.  Spicy level is spicy (hottest they do). Pretty good ramen thus far that I have been to in phoenix.  They actually have the spiciness in the broth/ramen and not some chili flake add-on or hot sauce on the side type of deal. So off to good start.  Definitely preferred the CURVED noodle instead of the straight, just has more to it.  Overall broth had flavor and was good.  Perfect amount of food for "regular hungry." You can always add noodles for like $2. So reasonable.   Downsides:  1. They forgot the egg (but they gave it on the side after we told them).  2. only 1 slice of chashu, (you can add on for additional price.) But I was expecting at least 2 slices or something. But the Chashu was done nicely. One of the better ones in phoenix.   Price:  $9.45 + tax for Miso ramen. Not too bad for ramen price.   Service: Friendly and fast. They did forget to put soft boil egg in both of our orders, which was weird as the egg wasn't an additional topping. It was included in the original ramen order. They promptly brought out both eggs on the side after we told them.   Parking: lot outside. no issue.  Environment: Medium size restaurant. More accommodating to smaller groups, more tables for 2.  Clean. Kitchen is open, so you can see what is going on.

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy miso ramen
Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu 5/18

THiCOgU7Ga7fwJMTJoEiyg.text: This place is soooooo cool. Atmosphere and happy hour is on point. I will be back! People watching was awesome too. Food was just mediocre that I had. But I think it was just my taste buds and for the meat. Will go to try another again and update review!

5PSMFiNnT29oQAZ0uJum0A.text: Holy Moly Ramen!!   This place is L-E-G-I-T!  There are seriously no words for how authentic and delicious this place is. I've had their specialty ramen bowl called the Nishikawa Black twice now - it's insanely good! The addition of the black garlic oil and fried onions takes it over the top. If you like your soup with a little kick in it, ask for it spicy....trust me on this one ;)  Nishikawa Ramen has definitely earned a spot in my weekly takeout rotation. If you like ramen, you 100% HAVE to check this place out!

AMOrHcu15oTnos-AL_rHPQ.text: I'm so happy they opened a location in Phoenix! I've been to the Chandler location once and have been wanting to come back, but it's a far drive so I haven't had the chance to and now I don't have to anymore. Wooo!  This is pretty close to work for me so I went for a quick lunch on their first week ish of opening. I had the chicken karage and miso ramen. Both were as yummy as I remember from 9 months ago when I tried it in their Chandler location. The broth was delicious and the soft-boiled egg and pork chashu were perfect.   I'll definitely be back. This is still the best ramen I've had in Phoenix so far.

NXW_35rm-xhy3ovvFlnDTg.text: Nisakawa Ramen  Recently opened restaurant on 32nd Street just South of Indian School Road from their original location on Ray Road and Cooper.  Had the Pork Gyozas and Tonkatsu Ramen Bowl.  The Tonkatsu Ramen Bowl consist of Pork broth, pork chashu, green onion, kikurage, seasoned egg, fish powder, sesame served with straight noodles and a hard-boiled egg. Very good ramen bowl with a nice tasting broth which is about the most important thing about the ramen to me.  The Pork Gyozas are made up of pork and veggies served with ponzu sauce. Love how they make one side crisp and just perfectly cooked.  This location is very modern and just opened recently, I kind of like the Chandler location charm and think the food there is a little better there than the new location.

9X9hUvhceAIpJQJ_Rt1AtQ.text: I was craving ramen even on a hot summer Phoenix day. The parking was easy with a lot outside. I was quickly seated. I ordered the Miso Ramen ($9.95). It came with the option of a soft or hard boiled egg. You can also order it with mild, medium, or hot spice. I got mine mild.   The ramen came out fast. The soup was creamy and I love having corn in my ramen. There was a little too much green onion for my liking. But overall, a great bowl of ramen for the price.   They give a carafe of water so you can refill on your own. I prefer this, actually. The service was super fast and friendly - definitely worth coming to!

vDRuCzhVAEYckNHAVP1fKQ.text: Super tasty! I'm not from the Phoenix area so I had no idea what to expect from ramen shops out there, but I'm glad my friends and I stopped here after hiking Camelback. We came in about 2pm not realizing they closed in 30 min. Service was quick. I'd love to come back and try the Spicy Tuna or Ikura Bowl

unZOQ9F8oLA1pIMOvBK8Eg.text: I went here on a friends recommendation and man was I not disappointed.  We tried to get in to here for lunch on a rainy afternoon, and after we were told there was a 45 minute wait we went elsewhere.  I went back that same day around 530 for an early dinner was sat immediately.    While a lot of the ingredients on their menu look odd and might have exotic names, don't let that scare you.   I got their Miso with medium heat and a soft boiled egg.  Wow.  The broth was so flavorful I was drinking straight from the bowl towards the end of my meal.  I could not get enough!  I also was able to try their Gyoza and spring rolls both of which were super tasty.     The space is super small and expect to get up close and personal with your neighbor but it's so worth it.

Ro5-Sw7LMPJeEr7jyCRx8A.text: I loooove ramen and this almost did the trick. I got the soy-based ramen and the serving of noodles was great with a huge slice of tender pork belly. However, the egg was boiled hard and I suppose if I had the choice I would prefer it soft. The broth was just lacking a touch of flavor. We also tried the friend chicken app which was flavorful if just over-cooked. I don't get ramen often but I may return.

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

SAjsbcVO5mEeIiwduS0sqw.text: Have been trying to step outside of our regular area and decided on this place tonight with a friend.  A nice surprise.  This is not a big restaurant or has a big menu but we were able to pick a couple of bowls of tasty ramen. I had the Miso while my friend had the traditional Tonkotsu. I would have liked my soup temperature a little hotter but overall we both enjoyed our soup.   We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Miso with additional bean sprouts.

HhtbyNaoOP-7-Q6M01XLFA.text: It makes me really happy to have a ramen place near where I live! And a pretty good one that is. There is plenty of parking outside which is a plus. The place itself is a bit small but clean.  But lets get to the food: I got a tonkotsu ramen with black garlic oil and a soft boiled egg. Noodles were nice and chewy, the broth was flavorful and at the right temperature, soft boiled egg was cooked perfectly and even though you cannot see it on the picture there is chasu pork. The pork is well cooked: soft and not dry. But I definitely wish there was more of it.  We also got the takoyaki that was cooked nicely and had a good amount of octopus. They have many different types of ramen and I cannot wait to go back and try the other ones!

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

JyZwhItKqAKFjCiPOet-ZA.text: I was BEYOND surprised when I first tasted this. Also this being curry base ramen. Probs the best ramen Phoenix has to offer. I've tried a couple places- north of Phoenix and Scottsdale and was mildly disappointed with them. The taste just wasn't there. BUT THIS PLACE. Damn. All the flavor came out, strong and tasty. I love me some flavorful soupy ramen. They also said they offer 2 different types of noodle- straight and curvy. Try the straight, as I was told that's made in-house and is softer. But this place definitely hit the spot if you're craving ramen!! One thing I would add is that they only give you a piece of pork (if you get pork tonkatsu)... so maybe order extra meat if you're not carbo-loading. Idk I'm used to getting at least 2-3 pieces of meat in my ramen so that's just me..

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

O4s5c4vEHdEqI5-ZquFX2Q.text: I've been to the other Nishikawa location and had never been to the one on Indian School. I happened to be in the area and was craving ramen.  I'm from Los Angeles, so my ramen palette, so to speak, is used to ramen that tastes closer to ramen from Japan.  Firstly, I ordered chicken karaage. The karaage here is very well cooked, well breaded and the perfect combo of crunchy to chicken meat. I'm used to it being served with Kewpie (Or Japanese Mayo) But here it was served with a dark sauce. I'm unsure what it was, but it surprisingly paired VERY nice with the karaage! 10/10 Would recommend.  For my main meal, I was SO excited to see curry ramen!!! I would have usually ordered the tonkatsu (it's usually what I order to see how good the ramen is). Buuuuuut, I LOVE Japanese curry and when I'm not home in LA, I CRAVE curry udon or karaage curry...... This. Curry. Ramen. Did. Not. Disappoint!  It was perfectly balanced with the chashu, noodles, onion and tempura crispies! I've been looking for an Arizona location that serves a good Japanese curry udon, but this curry ramen REALLY hit the spot!! It's very mild, so if you prefer spicy curry, add some spicy powder to it. I appreciate that the curry wasn't overly watery or overly thick. It was perfect. And it came with an egg so I didn't have to request an egg with my meal. 10/10 Will be back FOR SURE for this meal.  This place is fairly small but we were seated right away and all of our meals came right away. Service was great and the atmosphere was pretty relaxing. Good music playing and it was not crowded (came around 2pm-ish)  The only thing was they ran out of Asahi beer, which wasn't a huge biggie. We ordered Kirin instead.  All in all, this place tasted like home and I'll definitely be back to try more of the menu! Thanks for a good experience Nishikawa!

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Curry Ramen - noodles, chashu slices, green onion, tempura crispies, egg, seaweed.
Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken karaage - on bed of cabbage, lemon, and dipping sauce

cKPzJk7oOKcfUzec-niUyQ.text: I found this ramen place by chance. Their customer service is good and the spicy miso ramen that I ordered was so good. They have different flavor broths but I have only tried one and I was not disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7SzrSxqEd78BAu_WIRJ-qQ.text: This is the most authentic Ramen I've had since I've moved to Arizona two years ago. I like the miso Ramen with some added bamboo and some heat. I also like the iced green tea.

RTzeEdbM4jKxtIqmFXCZ9Q.text: I have visited Nishikawa ramen with my friends. I am a huuuuge fun of ramen that I have tried every ramen stores in the valley. Unfortunately this ramen wasn't my favorite. The broth was too watery and noodle was too soft. The broth doesn't smell good. It was unfortunate as I was excited to try out.  I will not go back again.  The customer service is acceptable but not so helpful and warm welcoming for kids.

pEIf9pIgXpitrORJMQ47Uw.text: Fantastic amazing ramen!  Nishikawa Black is my favorite..Yokohama is also amazing.. The broth is so succulent and flavorful addictive! Spring rolls and Chicken and Pork Gyoza appetizers are also a must try! Staff is top notch owner Jay ..cook Jeremiah and server Allison will go above and beyond to make your visit as memorable as possible!

eXSr-zmz2UFJOicObADa4w.text: Fast service, helpful staff that seemed knowledgeable about menu items. Food came out very quickly during lunch hour and tasted great. It was a bit out of my way from where I work, but I'm glad I gave it a try.

ol2OXn0TFC8qd9xjcABQPw.text: When we walked through the door it was small and cute.  The staff was very attentive,  we sat ourselves and they took our order right away.  We ordered the gyoza Nishikawa Black and the Yokohama style. Both dishes were freaking amazing!

-OpVmBxB74aL6MttQqDNyQ.text: FINALLY a ramen place has opened in our area. A real ramen place. Not just a noodly place that has ramen in the menu. Having lived in the PNW where you can hardly swing a curved noodle without hitting a ramen joint, this place is the real deal. The menu offers a few types or ramen with a concise choice of delectable side dishes. We have eaten here twice in a week and will make this place one of our regulars. The broth is flavorful and the portions are just right. I will say that if you ask them to spice it up they bring it! I asked for medium spice the first time and it was a tad too spicy for me and I love hot food. However, they have a nice shaker of ground chilies on the table so order regular and add your own. We will be back...tomorrow!

0oz3tRsIAEvtJS47x9Onow.text: This place is Soooooo delicious! Highly recommend the curry ramen, great appetizers... and the Green Tea is beyond refreshing and an experience in itself. You should check this place out!

5sXbQOW8SlKAW-1rWAuv8g.text: Best ramen in phoenix! The Nishikawa Black is fire flame. The gyoza and fried octopus appetizer are also amazing

EB0u77pxFZY7wM_tDjfgSw.text: This is a review for the non-pork eaters out there. If you don't eat pork but you do eat chicken and fish, the only option is veggie broth. I am sure the pork broth is good since they devote so much menu space to it but they should show the veggie stock some love. It needed a ton more flavor. Also all ramen comes with an egg except for the veggie ramen but they charge the same price. I had to pay extra to get my egg. Not fair somehow since the veggie ramen has to be cheaper to make than all the others. I would go back if they added a chicken broth and had more for non-pork eaters to choose from on the ramen menu. Anyway, the takoyaki was really good!

c3Rn9HHapbfwrNTD3SJX-g.text: Great place, great ramen, simple, easy in and out spot to eat some tasty ramen! Servers are kind and quick and get work done diligently!

7Z7lD9kc3v1l5guxtGCuMw.text: Went twice within a week, even after telling myself I wouldn't return bc of the service and extreme kitchen delays/misfires during the first visit.   Both times, the ramen was excellent. With our most recent trip, my husband and I agreed it's the best ramen we've had here in Arizona--and it's the closest to our favorite spots back in Hawaii where great ramen exists everywhere!   This time around, the service was extremely pleasant and accommodating--huge huge HUGE improvement from just 5 days prior.   Thank you Nishikawa Ramen for making things right and implementing quick changes to not only improve your business, but overall provide a better restaurant experience. We'll be regulars!

jabdLxufm1ehRlxp3UHldA.text: Great to have ramen spot near by, spiciest level is spicy but delicious, the wait can be long when doing to go

VSkloNvQ2dVOsliMwilDGg.text: Ok, probably the best tasting ramen I've had.  My wife agrees. Great staff too.

uPSKoHqA_u9CaPjX2DNrtg.text: Ramen is delicious. Small restaurant that fills up quickly. If the wait is long, order to take out and then eat outside...this is way faster!

hmx_aPd7OMgohi4djdxfhQ.text: Finally a place in Phoenix that gets ramen right! I stopped by on a whim and picked up the spicy miso ramen along with an order of chicken gyoza. The chicken gyoza was cooked to perfection and is some of the best I've ever had. My spicy miso ramen had the right amount of heat and a nice creamy broth with a rich flavor. The only thing I would change were the noodles were a tad over cooked and kind of stuck together. However, this was only a minor issue and did not take away from the amazing flavors in the ramen. The service was friendly, prompt and courteous. I will definitely be back and have recommended this place to a lot of people!

WOERw8IZZnce4ACUA4ivXA.text: I was excited for this Ramen restaurant to open.  However, there wasn't much flavor to the Tonkotsu ramen.  The pork was in large pieces that were difficult to eat with chop sticks.  Additionally, the pork had a lot of fat on the edges that I had to eat around.  I may go back to try a different dish, however, if the pork is not in smaller pieces to eat and without fat, it will still be a disappointment

7gMoGnJmWKau-34_GEjbYA.text: The Nishikawa ramen broth was delicious, would have preferred to have regular ramen style noodles instead of the straight noodles.

KaAmKYLKqPfrLkl_noKc_w.text: I just don't get the bad reviews.  This is an excellent ramen joint.    Fried squid was very good.  Chicken Karage excellent.  Pork Belly rice bowl, again very good.  Nishikawa black oil ramen was so great and great value.   Any complaints of serving size is utterly False.  These are filling bowls of ramen - the broth is authentic.  They make their own noodles.  In the valley, we can't be this picky when there are so few authentic options.  This restaurant could hold it's own in SoCal.

xUOYCQOLhvryJkGh8xthkA.text: I've been waiting for this place to open and  that was worth every minute. The service is good and attentive. The ramen was amazing. The broth had so much flavor and I add spice. That option is awesome by the way. I went for medium, which adds a nice kick.  The portion size was just right and filling. They are still waiting on their liquor license. When that happens that will be a great match.  This place is a must try.

jJT2c-vwBLgvxcexGYf54A.text: Delicious, favorable and friendly staff!!  I recommend anything on the menu but my favorite is the Nishikawa Black

KPl-sbRiXdQN3iTC5Cxe3w.text: Cherry Blossom was the only acceptable valley spot for ramen ... until now.  Now I have another place to indulge my broth-y, noodle love. And not just that, but their gyoza have that crispy, lacy, browned bottom I never get in Phoenix.   What it lacks in ambiance, it makes up for in flavor ... and I only go to places like this for the food anyway. Like no one is going to be taking their hot date here, but you'll come with the person you can sloppily slurp noodles with. That's kind of a lesson about life for the kids right there. If you're afraid to suck on some long, sauce covered ramen noodles in front of your date, why are you so willing to suck on other things?   It makes sense.

D0Snxm0rHEAIkFwctiV1yg.text: Hmm went in and was super packed with two waitresses. While we were seated the service was very slow, we sat and waited and we saw that there would be little chance of getting served soon but we waited some more. Then there were two people who came in after us who were asked for their orders, so I was disappointed I didn't get to try this location..... as we decided to leave.

9K1OrH2Jxy1yKRY7eu9chg.text: So far my friend and I have been here twice and the food is bomb. They're probably the only Ramen place I feel comfortable experimenting with new dishes in. My friend absolutely loves the Nishikawa Black and I usually get the Tonkotsu. They both come with a hard boiled egg I probably wouldn't otherwise touch at another restaurant but Nishikawa makes it look irresistible. We both have tried the Miso ramen as well and that was really really yummy with thin noodles. The kikurage is one of my unexpected favorite parts. 11/10 will eat again!

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mido ramen
Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tonkotsu ramen
Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nishikawa black on top, Tonkotsu on bottom

zi6YUOzjvjbiq699UmmomA.text: First of all, I think Nishikawa Ramen is a 4 star ramen place if you have to compare it with just the ramen in ARIZONA. I honestly think it is a lot  better than most of the ramen I've had here, including the ones in top notch Japanese restaurants in the valley. If I were to compare it to the ramen in LA, it wouldn't come close to 4 stars. I still thoroughly enjoyed my meal nonetheless.  For the ramen, I was told the Nishikawa black was the tastiest one but I opted for the tonkotsu. It was good; it was definitely on the salty side. The pork was fatty and tasty, not as tender as I would like it to be but it was not bad. We also had the beef bowl which was excellent. Our server warned us that the meat would be fatty. It was so good and tender. I couldn't believe that it only cost us $5.  I will definitely be back to try the other ramen styles.

DzrrIbueAbkI6ImkUch0jw.text: Very tasty, but my curry ramen was so strongly flavored I was sick of the taste shortly after we started eating. They were very nice and made up a little side dish of things for my son.

PL6SOAPyUHHjoDYeU46eRQ.text: A good bowl of ramen, especially considering there aren't many choices of ramen shops around this area. I ordered the tonkatsu ramen and the pork itself was not great. It was hard to bite and I felt the need for a knife and fork. The broth was pretty good and I loved the soft boiled egg. The noodles were well cooked and tasted fresh. I like how they give you a carafe of water on the table as well. The restaurant itself is small and quaint and I enjoyed eating in. The takoyaki was pretty good. If you're craving takoyaki it will definitely curb the craving, but they deep fry their takoyaki so it's a bit different than what you would get in Japan. All in all it was pretty delicious and I'm very happy there is a Japanese restaurant in town. Try it out!!

6s-Xdz75Ghlq8f5rZJtzjg.text: This ramen was amazing.  I'm so glad that it is close to my work.  The broth I can drink alone.  The space is small so it does get crowded.  This is just as comparable to the best ramen places in Orange County.

On2Ukqp89cv11rGusWfo7Q.text: My Ramen adventure was not planned today, it was an accident! I was in the "area" and was looking for a place to grab some food when I spy some of my Yelp families reviews. So of course I was like mmmm hmmm let me see what the hype is about.   Well I have to say I was pleasantly surprised! I got the Nishikawa Black Ramen bowl medium spicy and I really enjoyed it. Definitely diff then the traditional ramen. The noodles are not traditional but they were good, good firmness without being under or over cooked and they make them in house. Broth was super flavorful and garlic was def very present. I did get an extra hard boiled egg. Very, very tasty. Also just FYI the fat on the pork is supposed to be there it adds to the flavor, I just peel the fat off. The pork was very tender.  I would def give it a solid 4 stars. It is so far the better of the 3 places I have tried around the valley ( I had given up). This is not my first Ramen rodeo folks!   Service is good also...heyyyy Emily and Debbie.   If you are in the area I would definitely give them a try.

1LScElOM9J4fjIMV6WzNng.text: Just went here for the first time tonight. It was super good! We stuck with the original options. They give you 3 levels of spiciness; I chose the 3rd & most spicy and it was perfect. You can have you egg soft or hard boiled. Seating is kind of limited for be prepared for a slight wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2y2Rp4KAvsMS7YLiXsAUVA.text: I so very much wanted this to be my go-to local joint for gourmet ramen. I ordered three times, three different styles. I am underwhelmed. I really want flavorful spicy miso ramen that isn't too salty. Pork or beef, good noodles, corn, mushroom, bamboo shoots, green onion, sriracha, and more. Nishikawa can and should step it up.   By comparison, Ramen Dozo serves up a righteous bowl. So does Kubuki.

ukbtCmu469wjOuzMfKzNwg.text: I was excited to try a new ramen place in my neighborhood and read all the great reviews on yelp. Bonus that this place makes their own noodles. I had the tonkotsu broth, which was delicious, though not as thick as I generally like it. I asked to trade the pork chasu for another egg (I don't care for big pieces of pork) and they would not allow substitutions. Traditionally, ramen is highly customizable, so I was surprised by this. They were willing to remove the pork, but not replace it with a lower priced egg.   When my food arrived it looked and tasted great! However the "soft-boiled" egg was so hard that it was difficult to cut, even with my spoon. My stainless steel water glass had black spots on the inside (it may have been rust?) so I did not drink any water. The service was pretty good, but because of the dirty glass, over cooked egg, and no substitutions, I could only give 4 stars. I would definitely go back, but next time get the curved noodles and I would bring my own water bottle.

5POPszPbMnX_IQRk07bK-g.text: Congrats on opening the new location. We came in and were seated promptly. Our waitress was a complete sweetheart! Service was great because we ordered and our food came out about 5 minutes after. The broth and food is as amazing as the Chandler location but even better now that it is closer. Very authentic Japanese ramen and highly recommend the chashu pork and soft boiled egg. We also tried out their house green tea and that was really refreshing on a hot summer day. We overall had a great experience :) We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Egv-SMvGLwuGmRFq8BurlQ.text: We ordered the ramen to go and it was good. The only reason I'm giving this place 4 stars is because I wish it had more pork. Very reasonable price for this ramen.

oK1EBbnym8DqomGm5Tforw.text: I've had the Ramen here Six times and up until today, I would have said it was the best in town.  I hope today was a fluke and not a sign that they have gone to pot. I asked for medium spicy and it was way too spicy (and I like spicy) I asked for extra meat and an egg and got neither.  After I asked about it, they brought one very fatty slice of pork and an ice cold egg.  Only ate half of my ramen.  When I got home I felt so nauseated it took everything I could muster to keep from vomiting  and I was so gassy and sick feeling that I'm not sure I'll ever go back there again.  Sorry restaurant owner but I did try and tell my server who acted like she couldn't care any less.

e73hLzSpvWYg7hfTCk9E6A.text: This place is quite small, so I would definitely be ready for a wait.  I order the pork gyoza and tonkotsu ramen. They were both so good!! The broth of the ramen was flavorful and wasn't salty to my liking. I also like how it wasn't too oily.  My boyfriend ordered the beef bowl and that's the reason for the one less star. The sauce on the beef bowl was wayyyy too salty! I'm not sure if there was a mistake on the sauce but it tasted just straight up SOY SAUCE AND SALT. There's more to that on a teriyaki sauce!!! Maybe they mistaken salt with sugar when making the sauce? I don't think we'll ever try that dish ever again.   We'd definitely go back for some ramen, but learned our lesson about their beef bowl with sauce

XUu0AchH0pjadT7EGwUZAw.text: After recently visiting Japan, I've been craving Ramen! We started out with potstickers which were great and then got a bowl of the classic ramen with meat. The food was great! It was flavorful and made fresh. The meat was tender and a great addition to the bowl. I'll be back!

tYD9CcCiExMeq7U7uDxSAg.text: I started off with the ika geso karaage which is deep fried squid legs.  It came with a honey mustard dipping sauce.  I found it acceptable, but nothing special.  Some other places marinade the squid before deep frying.  This place seems to just put lots of salt.  It was pretty salty, but the dipping sauce was pretty sweet so it evened out.  It's strange to see honey mustard in a Japanese menu.  I had the Tonkotsu ramen.  The soup was nice and rich.  Lots of wood ear mushrooms.  I first thought it was seaweed because it was long, dark slender strips.  The noodles were cooked just perfectly.  The chashu was extremely tender where it started falling apart when I picked it up.  Wish they didn't cook as much.  The egg is hard boiled unless you request soft boiled which I normally pick.  The ice tea was oolong tea, but it was $4.00.  It wasn't listed on the menu, but I didn't expect it to be that expensive.  Didn't taste much different from the ice tea I get from other restaurants.  They give you a pitcher of ice water filled with lemons.  I wish they asked if you wanted lemons in the water.  I love lemons, but the lemon flavor was interfering with the flavor of the food.  Maybe if they put in less lemons or if I added some sugar I could make lemonade.  Great service.  The wait staff went around making sure all the tables were good.

JUyXOpsSZA6buyKeWqnAyQ.text: Enjoyed the vegetarian ramen and husband enjoyed the beef bowl. Tasty Japanese options.

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegetarian ramen and edamame.  Takoyaki (Octopus appetizer) in the background).
Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegetarian ramen after stir. Yummy!
Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef bowl.

r-jdaqNIrsgDhzds2ZDNOg.text: This is the best ramen in Phoenix. Everytime I go I get the Gyoza, Nishikawa Ramen and an Echigo beer. The flavors are so on point and the  service is great. Emily and Colleen are the nicest. The place is so clean and there's always  something interesting on the TVs. I seriously go 3x a week amd you should too.

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. New beverage menu. Try the Orion Japanese beer!
Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I really love this place.

cWf1lSq84YALSvHJdOjhiw.text: We have been twice so far. It is awesome!!! They are super fast too. On a night where we don't want to be out long it's ideal. Their ramen is full of flavor and you can add anything you would like to it. Definitely a worth while stop.

sDEKUbM_QqQr5wkQ1wR8XQ.text: We had a great experience tonight at Nishikawa!  We loved our chicken gyoza, chicken kaarage, tonkotsu, and pork bowl.  The staff was friendly and knowledgeable, which made our experience even better!

MDzYVmXxMw63w5B3tnlGnQ.text: The best ramen in town. Now, I don't have to travel to Chandler to satisfy my craving. Try the Nishikawa black, takoyaki, and chicken karaage.

c3vzdcdwRJLKKhe2KnZ5qQ.text: Great service and awesome ramen!!!!   Will be back and get take out too. Potstickers were also the bomb!

-6zEiYD1KaiOj9doXCQUcQ.text: Exceeded my expectations.  Tonkatsu ramen, Katsu and Spicy Tuna bowls were delectable.

2XQMHJ9JzuZ-2R7W_WtGsg.text: This place is alright. I'm from Hawaii where there's obviously many of the best Asian restaurants in the world (besides Asia of course). It's the closest restaurant we can find that doesn't really f*** up a good spicy miso ramen. In Hawaii, we have Sapporo style miso ramen which is delicious. You'll agree with me that this place is just okay if you've tried Hawaii, Japan, or Cali ramen. Their takoyaki was good but I was disappointed by how little they give of actual tako (octopus) that was inside the balls. Their ramen broth is somewhat inconsistent. One night it was salty. The other night it wasn't as salty. Their ramen is creamy and fatty (how I like it). It's not like watered down or see through like some other ramen places. This restaurant is small so don't be coming in here all the time with parties of 10 and being all loud. Be respectful to people who are eating by themselves or on a date with their loved one. Prices ($) are reasonable here. I can tell that the gyoza is the frozen kind from the Asian store. I would like this place more if they sold homemade pork and cabbage gyoza. Other than that, 3 stars. Also, for their chicken karaage (please don't call it breaded chicken or chicken karage, you will hurt my ears), I wish they served it with Siracha-Mayo sauce. Not a sweet peanut sauce.

aYlM_O7NDanD0T4K0CCixA.text: The last time i was here the ramen was too oily. That's the only complain i have. The ramen is authentic and It tastes good but with less oil it will be perfect!  And also i hope there is an option for chicken or tempura shrimp in addition to the fatty pork. The takoyaki is the best!! It was as good if not better than the one i had in Tokyo 4 months ago.

1G7Vjq4HYZ9GNpL-4RlJeA.text: This place has real deal ramen!  Super efficient staff and good value for the $$.  Get the black and don't be afraid of the spice.

-28G9bPsl4yae2qAyUy4Qg.text: Amazing service and food! I ordered the beef bowl and it was so good! I can't wait to come back!

g38AACyMMHIIOu6pZxoAhA.text: We've seen that this place has been open in our area for a while (apparently their 1 year anniversary is this April). We love good ramen and decided to go in. The shop is kinda small, big enough to fit maybe 25-30 diners at once. The music they play is all anime theme songs - not really my taste but I expected that from the window art in front. Regardless, we didn't even get ramen. I ended up ordering the beef bowl while my fiance  got the spicy tuna bowl. It was pretty good, and the bowls aren't very big so it feels like a light meal. We will try this place again for the ramen sometime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef bowl
Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spring rolls

jTjy_zYeFOEq-5rTL3Ke3g.text: All of the food here contains MSG!!!!!  Ok. I'm back and I ordered my fav plus a big cold Sapporo to wash it down and all was going well until my neighbor asked the waitress if there is MSG in the food And that answer is YES!!!!! Sadly, I will Never come back.  Please note: Fantastic  ramen broth needs NO msg.

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

w4So1JNyOt5Qw9KHdHfD7A.text: Best ramen I've had in Arizona! The Nishikawa Black Ramen is worth every cent you pay. Next time I visit Phoenix I'm totally coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nishikawa Black Ramen

AUnzCJcQy9o8PzqfFTksjg.text: This place was so good! I loved the ramen with miso broth and the gyoza was some of the best I've ever had. Great service and nice little atmosphere. A little loud in the evening but that's testimony to hope comfortable locals must feel. I was just visiting this area.

V5b_EDDFP7fgD41iYGXQYA.text: I have been excited to try Nishikawa for a while now and I finally had a chance to check it out. It's a small shop, but very cute. The staff was fine, they were nice but not overly so. We tried the karaage, nishikawa black, and tonkotsu. The karaage had a good crunch, was light and crispy!  The Nishikawa black ramen was good, the noodles were perfect, great soft egg with a good amount of flavor, but it did seem like the amount of black garlic oil was overpowering. The tonkotsu has good flavor, but the noodles seemed a bit soft for both of us! Overall pretty good ramen shop, especially for Phoenix!  **I would add - double check your receipts I noticed after that we got someone else's and it was for 15 dollars more than what I got. I should have checked at the time!

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dFepN-0956FII0oIej2JdQ.text: This place is pretty good! While they do have different types of ramen such as the standard shoyu and tonkotsu ramen, they also have curry ramen. However my go to is the Nishikawa black with extra charshu pork. Their takoyaki is decent too! The only problem is that on weekends it can get pretty busy with a long wait. Overall there have been no problems with this place each time I've been, other than that weekend waits can be a little long.

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nishikawa black ramen

t1iZ2eSiXLz-Y7zjQiiBgA.text: So this is a little embarrassing to admit, but I'd never really had ramen before. Therefore I didn't have a lot of expectations. But now that I have been, this place has set the standards for anywhere else I go.  The egg was cooked perfectly, the noodles done well, the savory spices and level of heat were just right. Others in my group didn't care for the pork but, who am I to complain, I'm a first timer and I ate it all.

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bwO1qHN8FGnPdG9azfdfTw.text: Don't miss this place if you're looking for some delicious ramen in Phoenix! It's usually pretty busy and small inside so be prepared for a wait or get takeout! The curry ramen was delicious, definitely coming back to try other options.

gxOevb8clgQ5vO766hov0Q.text: Another ramen shop in Phoenix? I had to try.... only after I reached my goal in diet.  Despite of arriving here around 4pm, they were quite busy.   We ordered miso ramen and tonkotsu Black. Tonkotsu Black was served with typical hakata ramen (thin) noodles. It is very easy to over cook this type of noodles. They did okay, but I would have preferred more texture, less cooking time.   Miso on the other hand uses regular egg noodles and this one was cooked perfectly.  Black has enough garlic in it but broth was a bit weak for my liking. Miso had good flavor, I would order miso next time or try Shio or Syoyu.  Gyoza was cooked well but well I prefer to eat my gyoza with simple soy sauce and vinegar, with a small drop of hot oil. They use something else for dipping sauce. Too bad as their gyoza was cooked just right.  Service was a bit of questionable side. I was confused who was our server and the one came often was just okay. I guess they are short-staffed or not used to handling large crowds.  I like some of their cute decors from Ghibli movies. I love his movies and was nice to see some characters stuff there.

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cat from the Kiki&#39;s delivery, Ghibli movie
Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tonkotsu Black
Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Miso ramen

Of543ji-y_U_qC5ZQ-lh9A.text: I was on the hunt for some great ramen. Something that sounded so good and I'd never had it before. A friend recommended this place. It was small but comfortable and clean. The service was very friendly. I had the Miso ramen bowl. Very interesting combo of noodles, pork , a hard boiled egg and broth. I thought the broth would have been more flavorful. I also had the chicken karaage (fried) it was really good. I was surprised that the soda was a can ($1.50) but you're to full from the broth to drink much aI think I would try it again and get their curry bowl but really I'm still on the hunt for something that really impresses me.

enXGQsAvHZ8i4LJBWu2vRg.text: This place doesn't fail me, however I've never dined in. I always get my ramen to go. I have had the Tonkatsu and fried squid. Both really good. Tonkatsu can be slightly salty which is why I decked on star but still very flavorful when eaten with everything. Just don't drink the broth after. The gyoza wasn't my favorite but not terrible.

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gyoza
Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tonkatsu

7c_ariGgsuvr8HzVtHf3ig.text: By far the best ramen in Phoenix!!!!! I drive 30 minutes just to go here and sometimes have to wait to be seated but it's so worth it! If I lived by the location, I would eat it at least once a week. I get the curry ramen with medium spice and it's perfection! Usually I can't finish a bowl of ramen but man, I finish this one because it's too good to waste! Such a unique blend of flavors with fresh noodles. I do request curve noodles over the straight ones. Oh and their pork gyoza is some of the best I've ever had! If you like ramen, go there now!

K1y_4rJm6tBGzuEdoijwnA.text: Ramen is such a great meal for a cold rainy day! My boyfriend and I were able to come right when they opened at 11 and we weren't even the first ones in the door! This was our first time here, but just a word of wisdom, check the yelp waitlist because there can be a pretty long wait. For a starter, my boyfriend wanted to try the spring rolls. They were pretty good! They were very crispy and freshly fried. We also tried two different types of ramen. We tried the Yokohama ramen at a mild spice level with a soft boiled egg. While it was passable, the broth was not as flavorful as I would have liked. The curly noodles were perfectly cooked, though! We also tried the curry ramen at a medium spice level. I really enjoyed this ramen as the broth was very flavorful and had the taste of Japanese curry. They also don't hold back on the spice level! The soft boiled egg was absolutely delicious and definitely worth asking for. It was perfectly cooked and well-seasoned. We will definitely be back to try some of the other ramen options.

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Curry ramen (front), Yokohama ramen (back)
Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spring rolls

moE_RAgzIkctXq0ZJhlqwQ.text: Nishikawa ramen place seats about 30 people. We were there Saturday for lunch but managed to get a table. There's a fast turnover on tables so not a very long wait time.   They offer traditional ramen dishes and appetizers. All their ramen comes with straight white noodles or the curly yellow noodles. The curly ones had more of a bite and chewiness. We ordered the Yokohama, curry and Nishikawa ramen and they were all delicious, each very different from the other. I liked the fact that they gave option of either soft or hard boiled eggs and extra add-ins.   Their ika karage was delicious. It started off by having a strong ocean smell but it had nice chewiness and seasoning to it. It was cooked perfectly. Their chicken karage was equally tasty so it was perfect for my son who doesn't enjoy seafood.   Overall, very pleasant place to grab some ramen. Definitely will return to try their rice dishes.

cVYLSnsCLROIodTJD870Rw.text: I'm a little annoyed with the lack of service and attention from the waitress and the cook...after I specifically requested the "curvy" noodles and I got the straight noodles.. I'm not one to return an order and complain, but I did point it out to the waitress and she just shrugged and apologize and sucked it up while eating this Ramen..it kind of ruin it for me, but it is what it is.. at least the "soft boiled egg" was perfection. This Foody is annoyed after weeks of looking forward to eat here.. I would have second thoughts of coming back.. not recommended at all

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TasAw3i-sBLJkeEDRlzzhA.text: If you go at night, you may be a bit confused because name of the place doesn't light up, but you're in the right place. It's small but it's PACKED so I knew that had to mean it was good. Luckily I didn't have to put myself on a waitlist so I was seated immediately. I tried the mango soda which is childishly sweet and fun. Then I got the black ramen which was the best idea. It was hot and flavorful and the waitresses were all very attentive and nice. I had a fabulous time. The ramen tastes even better as leftovers, I'm not sure how but I've been daydreaming about it so I'll be back!   This wasn't a date but I went with a friend and it's a nice place to catch up. You can't gossip much because the tables are close together and your neighbors will overhear.

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nishikawa Black

g-UPOGLfOAbtVLM8Q4iCnQ.text: Glad the area now has a good ramen joint! It's not something I was painfully aware that we were lacking, but now that it's there...I definitely appreciate it.  I came in around dinner time on Saturday, and it was busy, but there were still a few seats available. The place isn't big, but they've got a good layout to maximize tables. Food comes out really quick - which helps with the turnover rate, I think.  I kind of had my heart set on trying the fried squid (Ika Geso), so I got that. My server had a lot of good suggestions in terms of ramen, and highly recommended the Nishikawa Black. I do the opposite and order the Yokohama Style, which wasn't a bad idea but I probably should have gone with the recommendation. The fried squid was okay, a decent balance between the crunchy and the chewy. The sauce was like a miso mayo type of dip, and it was alright too. Overall, the fried squid was just good. I may order again, I may not. Who knows.  Anyways, on to the important part! The Yokohama was pretty good, and I wasn't mad about it. It didn't leave me as satisfied as I thought it would though, and I felt like it could have used more chashu (which was delicious, by the way). The broth was very mild in flavor. I will definitely be trying the Nishikawa Black next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yokohama Style Ramen
Photo of Nishikawa Ramen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ika Geso (fried squid)

9CYopSHu2p7JswFXG8kKXw.text: Loved this place. No wonder it is so busy!  My husband and I arrived around 6:30 tonight (Thursday) and we were lucky enough to get the last open table. We shared the pork gyoza which I liked a lot. The sauce had a little bit too much of a lemon flavor but I still enjoyed them. I had the black ramen bowl with mild spice. I couldn't come close to finishing it but everything was so tasty. The broth...so yummy. My husband had the curry ramen bowl and thought it was good. Service was a little lacking but not bad. Just not super attentive or fast, but the place was packed so that could be why. We will be back soon!

Jswj1eXlKvlsoiypEgAnEA.text: Hipster Trendy Garbage! Since this place is so popular and I love ramen, we decided to try.  Started with chicken karaage and the Ikura bowl. They shouldn't be trying to pass this sad fried chicken as karaage. Over cooked and under seasoned. The dipping sauce, which made it taste even worse, tasted like some cheap bottle sauce you would find in the "Oriental" section at a grocery store. The Ikura bowl was just as disgusting. The salmon roe tasted as if they froze and thawed it multiple times. There's nothing wrong with frozen, but it's like they thawed it everyday and froze it at night when they didn't sell and repeated that process until they sell it. Next up Yokohama ramen. Sad watered down broth with cheap packaged noodles. I don't expect too much from the noodles, since I know they are store bought. Sadly they we're undercooked sitting in a broth that wasn't hot enough to cook them further. The worst part is the egg. They ran out of soft boiled eggs! Thanks for robbing me of one more umami flavor, especially since this ramen needed it badly. The pork pieces looked at first glance to be ok, until I took a bite. I immediately spat it out. I have nothing against pork fat. Fat is flavor. But the overcooked hardened and almost crunchy fat layer had no flavor anymore. Again robbing this dish of much needed flavor. The pork was mostly fat(99%), which would be ok except they somehow rendered all the flavor out already. I took one bite of noodle, one bite of pork, and sipped a little soup and that was all I could do.  The other bowl of ramen, which came about 10 minutes before mine, was the Nishikawa black. Since it was order with the hot level of spiciness, I didn't really get to taste the broth. Similar to the other bowl, the broth was too mild in comparison to the chili. I love spicy, but this had no balance. Since Japanese chili isn't that spicy to begin with, this was very disappointing. Someone was hungry or I think this bowl of ramen might have not gotten eaten either.  The abundance of people getting take out would make you think the food is of good quality. Since the seating is fairly minimal, I could see why take out was a preferred option. This goes along with take out orders being fulfilled before in store customers.  This is not authentic ramen. This is very much an American take on ramen, jazzed up to appear more authentic than it is. I actually went home and made myself a packet of store bought ramen to rid my mouth of the disgusting flavors of Nishikawa.  I had higher hopes for a place that had a smaller menu. Where the focus could be on making a few dishes really good instead of a lot of dishes just ok. But even that concept fails here and it fails hard.

cMM1NvL2Z_yKsSNwlNaa2g.text: Wow and Wow! When we say food is art yes it is so True with this place. It was as if I took a quick trip to Japan for a Ramen fix. I had the house Nishikawa Ramen and it was AMAZING! There are so many beautiful layers of succulent flavors. My taste buds have not danced this much in months. I selected medium flavor and it was spicy....just be ready for it! We are so lucky Nishikawa Ramen is in Phoenix. Will be back maybe tomorrow.

XoBeYjqhmZd4qpxf_4YaXg.text: Best ramen in the valley hands down there are places closer to use but we drive all the way from buckeye  to come here.

UmcHdPepF6XplD4r2EEg2A.text: My husband and I love going here!  It's our favorite restaurant. I used to go to a spectacular ramen place in California (Daikokuya) and was worried that I wouldn't be able to find anything that compares to it when I moved here. I was wrong!  Nishikawa's ramen is just as good, but our waitress Colleen is what makes it our favorite place to eat!  Colleen is a truly wonderful person and a joy to talk to; she is one of the reasons that we go to Nishikawa. Everyone at this restaurant does a very good job and eating there is always a wonderful experience. :)  If you don't know what to order, try the Miso soup and ask for straight noodles instead of curly (much better!)  P.S. they will make it spicy for you if you ask!

KiJxYwZeYkUeYKBmNC6aiA.text: Tried the black garlic, tonkotsu and curry ramens. All are exceptional. Curly noodles are thick and yellow, straight noodles thinner like rice noodle texture. Both excellent. They sear the chasu and it tastes outstanding. Just wish they put a little more vegetable or meat in the bowl for 10-13$. Still this is my favorite place to get ramen in the area- big flavor, little wait time. Great for takeout.

F3Dd9bSvTQ8XCac2fhJL5g.text: We were excited to try a new place!  Food was very good...service was okay... It was really warm in the spot...they just opened, so I'm sure that they will get the thermostat figured out soon enough. We def felt rushed through...Maybe because it's small and they have a few tables. We enjoyed it, but will probably make the drive for the original location next time.

Tz7qvZdew78BzGt7inn7Wg.text: Yum! Yum! Yum! I had never had ramen and was a little nervous, but it is delicious and not scary! I ordered the Miso and wife got the House Special- Nishikawa which the server said was the most flavorful on the menu. Portions are huge. I couldn't finish mine, so lunch is ready for tomorrow too. We will definitely be back, especially when it's cold out!

3DXWmSQXoHcRJtCXX8_xng.text: It's my first review for yelp, and I definitely want to gave it to this excellent ramen spot in Phoenix. Quality and authentic ramen! Service was fast and friendly. I traveled to Phoenix for a week and went there twice. I'm a big fan of ramen, and I love their broth and curved noodles so much! I tried so many others and I didn't like that much. I ordered spicy Tonkotsu ramen with soft egg for first visit, and signature spicy Nishikawa black for second time, and they're just perfect for my appetite. I added a lot sides in my ramen and made it a colorful looking. I let them took out the chashu for me this time because their portion size is too big for me. I definitely want to try more food here once I travel to Phoenix again. I heard they already have two restaurants in Phoenix area. I hope they can open more in other cities, lol~ btw I never heard any ramen shop called Nishikawa, I thought it's super cool()  Spicy Tonkotsu Ramen with soft egg, menma, kikurage, bean sprout, green onion, dried seaweed, fried onion and black&white sesame seed.  Spicy Nishikawa Black ramen Spicy with black garlic oil, soft egg, menma, kikurage, bean sprout, green onion, dried seaweed, fried onion and black&white sesame seed.

EZsLs_0FKzWEGVSNwjJTGA.text: Every place I've moved I've been in search for ramen. In NYC I was spoiled by Minka, Kambi, Ivan Ramen, and Ippudo. LA has countless great places. This is it for Phoenix. We also had the fried chicken and gyoza which remind me of good night market street food. I plan to become a regular.

bmxst2EA6IaStifdkxwuOg.text: I've been patiently waiting for this place to open. So happy to have a ramen shop in the hood and this place did not disappoint. Ramen was really good. The service was good as well. Great alternative to other fast food restauraunt options in the area.
