LxueyyOQPKXC2NsXJD7tPQ.text: I will use the following words to describe our dining experience here: No, No, No, No, No.   What an insult to Japanese Ramen and anything Asian...how much salt is enough for seasoning? Six pounds in a single bowl? It definitely felt like 7...7 whole pounds of Sodium Chloride. My Black ramen was so salty I could consciously sense the renewal of my lingual papilae...in layman's term...I thought the outer layer of my tongue was falling off because my ramen was so salty. For $12? One could attempt creativity with a pack of Nissin Ramen (priced $.25), 1 single slice of pork (idk...$1) and end up with a much better culinary experience.  Karagge chicken was great though. Did not care for calamari.

GUwLylov91_MVlACPuW_Lw.text: My husband and I were kind of skeptical of the place but they proved us wrong. Their food was amazing. They're limited on space but overall the food was great. Highly recommend.

5PfL1Maxbp09D31ai8ogyQ.text: I was gonna give 4 star, but got dismayed from one their servers. Let me start with the food quality. The ramen was 'okay' (a little too much oily). I ordered the fried calamari and it was a little tough. But you should try to attest.  Then moving on to the server. She's in front when I came in, as she told me that I can sit anywhere. Then, a couple with kids were behind me, and she did entertain them all the way, brought them down to the table. So in short, she took their order where I'm supposed to be the first one to be asked .  Luckily, another server just passed by my table so I took the chance and told him that I'm ready to order. End of story  But perhaps, this is something your management should keep an eye on. I'm not sure if she's one of those typical racists(?). Though she didn't seem to look like one because she's an Asian   Here's how she ignored me and instead took the orders from the couple who were just behind me.

ujlOeB8fdjUySrkEwm3Ejw.text: Really nice area and restaurant all together you have your space that you need. Customer service is great but not too pushy which is perfect and the ramen is really good like really good I loved it just wished they had chicken but that's not traditional which I get but overall great restaurant all together I highly recommend!!!

YvFC9ncQuerF-X_bdmznvQ.text: Service and food were great! Their ramen is very flavorful. We got our food right away which is always a plus! The place wasn't too loud which was good because I had my newborn with me. Something else I appreciated was that their bathroom was super clean, impressive since they only have one restroom and it's gender neutral!

aylla_JksKN1J0puArxsBQ.text: I tried Nishikawa for the first time last night. It's a decent Ramen. It doesn't compare to my favorite place that I went to twice a week while living in Southern California but it's the closest I've found since moving to Phoenix.  One great thing is that they give you a choice of ordering it hot/spicy, which is the way I like it.  The only downside I found was the ambience. It was a little cold for my taste but I will definitely order to go and try every Ramen on the menu!

HFDixTRLP3A5vPhl1AlgrA.text: I have been going to the Nishikawa in Chandler for years now.   Pros: This new location is a lot closer to me, which is nice. Fairly authentic ramen with great noodles. Service is friendly and quick. Side dishes are all delicious.  Cons: This location clearly has different staff in the kitchen and the food is not as good. The broth is much fattier and not as flavorful, the pork is fattier and tougher, and most of the time they are out of soft boiled eggs. It still gets the job done when I crave ramen but if I have time, I drive 30 min to Chandler.

kc7APZUJIieSRxp9FNR00g.text: This place has solid ramen.  The food tastes great and the staff were friendly.  Give this place a shot if you are in the area and wanting to have some ramen.

10Qyi2xwuNuR0yb7WLOsHg.text: The staff were there to greet upon entering the restaurant and the place was clean. No wait for lunch during the week. We had five of us and enjoyed the space we had. There was enough room to be comfortable and enjoy good food and conversation. We ordered 3 different ramen bowls, pork gyoza, and spring rolls. We had the Tonkotsu Bowl, Nishikawa Black, and the Curry Bowl. Everyone enjoyed the bowls and the appetizers. Tonkotsu is more traditional and probably had the best taste. We will return when in the area.

xdtnIzWQlDX7GV3NxQodIg.text: I worked in Japan 20 yrs ago and have bern going 4x per year since.  I am a huge fan of ramen & yakigyoza.  That said, I rarely find good ramen in the US, and especially find it impossible to find great yaki gyoza.  Steamed on too, crispy on the bottom.  Well, found it at Nishikawa, amazing how good the broths are.  The Miso and Shoyu are excellent.  The yaki gyoza perfect.  Only suggestion, get hot oil (La-yu) for the gyoza and shichimi spice for the ramen.  I would pay extra, drop the lettuce and lemon slice.  This place is amazing

a1lmmK9SQt2z8bgT-0_mOw.text: Their Tonkotsu Ramen has an amazingly flavorful broth. The soft boiled egg was perfectly cooked. Pork was delicious. And the noodles seemed fresh.  This is very authentic and same as what you can get in Japan!

aAPL7uWpkaOgDnTLe597zg.text: First time trying this place and I fell in love with the taste, freshness, presentation, and the prices. Ramen was cooked very well, good portion too.

ecAWj2gZCJHwYS-tyP2MsA.text: Normally this my go to comfort but not heavy food spot. I don't know many places in Phoenix that serve miso ramen as good as this place.   But tonight, I was craving a bowl after having had an exremely long day at work. Picking up a bowl for take out was my ideal plan. I tried to look up the menu on their website to order for my husband. The way the website is formatted doesn't allow me to view the menu clearly on my phone. Thank you Yelp! Because of the menu images, I was finally able to find what I wanted to order.   Finally having my order ready, I called. And called. And called. And called. Their phone isnt working!  I hope theres nothong wrong and this business isnt going under. The food is amazing, but I don't undstand take put of you cant call it in. I dont want to sit or stand the bar for 15 min while Im hungry and waiting to go home.   I hate to give 3 stars because the food here is great but the lack of a phone now is just strange. I feel like any business should stay on top of the phone service to keep topnotch customer service available.

j7zgSUWXUPzJX0fqMteQUA.text: Possibly the best ramen spot in Phoenix. I typically eat at shensen gumi in Orange County. I gotta say this one comes very close in comparison. Except this place has better quality control.   Another good note is they let me swotch my pork for beef for extra charge which i don't mind. Most ramen joins wont do that.  Service was also friendly and quick.   Keep it up and this place will establish a strong reputation.

RsThXEIZ88snzbtanYA_IA.text: This is the worst ramen place I've been to. We were in Phoenix on a layover so we decided to try this place after seeing the amazing reviews.  The first thing we noticed was the terrible service. We were told to sit anywhere we would like and then when we went to sit at a medium sized table they quickly corrected us and said any small table and kept repeating them self's until we found a seat. This wouldn't have been an issue if they did so politely and originally. After sitting down we were given a menu and a pitcher of water, it doesn't seem like they have any other beverages at this restaurant which would explain why our drink order was never taken. To finish off the bad service upon ordering my girlfriend tried to order the SHIO Ramen and was rudely told that she should just order the Miso because that's what other people get and they assumed she wouldn't want the SHIO even after we spent a few minutes looking at the menu deciding.  The wait from order to getting our food wasn't too long as we got our ramen after maybe 10 minutes, the presentation on both the Miso and the Nishikawa Ramen was great, however neither ramen tasted as good as they looked. We could have gotten microwaveable ramen for much cheaper and it would have been better.  I usually like to give restaurants at least 2 shots to wow me however I will not be returning to this restaurant again.

zuodIVyW435URU8rs3El5A.text: Sooo, definitely the best ramen I have had in a while/outside of California/Japan. And, it's in Phoenix?!? I've realized you can find pockets of goodness in various places in and around Phoenix - buuutt this was actually and legitimately good. I dislike the ramen places that skimp on the salt...so if you are into health food ramen maybe you shouldn't go here. I had the miso ramen -  Flavorful broth with options of a soft boiled and hard boiled egg - that in itself should convince you this is awesome.

msUKneySTqx-_2VgGrqGFA.text: Happened  on this place by chance while looking for a place to have lunch withy girls.  First impression FANTASTIC!  Friendly energetic staff,  atmosphere, fun and inviting,  food....  AMAZING.  Highly recommend this place to friends and family or to anyone that wants to step out of the norm.  I'd give more stars if I could

YgaNdWg4OB7iCGEqQW45Fg.text: Been here twice, so far so good! Oishi! I love the ramen with black garlic oil. Aside from ramen, there are great starters like the gyoza and karage. Even if it's over 100 degrees outside, you have to try this place!

Y5I6sgL3mttTnhSI5lW6eQ.text: Stopped by this little spot after church for a little lunch. I order the $12.95 black noodle bowl (can't remember the name) and it was very tasty. The pork that was in the soup was a little fatty but had decent flavor. The soup was a little bland but with a little salt, pepper, and a few heaps of the red chili powder that they leave on the table, it made it better. The other people in my party enjoyed their bowls also. I would go again. *Warning* I normally eat spicy foods and I ordered my soup with the medium spice. I truly felt the heat during and "after" eating.

AHC6ObHDO5HK_nv19gnTrw.text: My sister took me here and not to mention that this is my first time. I got the curry ramen with soft boiled egg and it was sooooo good. I finished  my bowl in less than 15min. The soft boiled is perfectly cooked. Just perfect place for this kind of weather.

BqacVsHv3S3t02vr-0pt_Q.text: I eat here often. The Nishikawa Black with curly noodles is amazing! Everything else that I've eaten here is good too, and pricing is reasonable.

k659iR7kugNIds1nz5iHwg.text: Waiting for 15 mins to order! Only one server working during lunch time? Really?? Food is great but poor service. Im on my lunch just wasted 15mins waiting.

OZ-88f-6F2fNlQDMq72j-g.text: This is not your college Ramen place.  Nickikawa brings Ramen to the 21st century. I really enjoyed the robust flavor of the broth and all of the ingredients in the Ramen. There pastor is fresh and the company is wonderful.

Uu5twc82FyQ-QznY5hX00g.text: Great quality of ramen ! The base of the ramen soup is very good and tasty. The rice bowls are equally as dell it very small portioned for the price .  The place is super clean and bright. Awesome staff

Zti_kwTbyILXrDCtBjuQ9Q.text: Best Ramen I've had in the valley.   Everything I've had here is 5 stars and the service is excellent.

Dx8ltfGQemxaD89qLs1_qw.text: I had high hopes for this ramen spot since it's in close proximity to where I live. Seating is limited and the host asked my boyfriend and I to stand outside because they did not have room yet. Definitely wouldn't have been a problem if it wasn't raining... The soups were visually appealing but the broth wasn't as rich as I would have liked and overall the pricing for what you get wasn't worth it in comparison to the many other ramen places I have tried. A positive is the takoyaki was flavorful. I would not return to this restaurant.

lmj9_9ijVbOC1tNYMkhpbg.text: good noodle good boss  good service best ramen in pheonix Come here twice a week during this trip

ombyQy9kdc3-noSQMe_qAw.text: I was introduced to this place by a coworker. Food was great and prices were decent. Definitely recommend it if you are looking for a good, fast and authentic noodles.

jySftTTbZyW3CjNSsZbsHw.text: Great ramen spot, Had the Tonkotsu with extra pork and medium spicy. Fantastic and rich.  Need to come back to try the other broths!

OlQIbxEE7qDYikgIBgbZlg.text: Incredibly yummy! Awesome and attentive staff, Amy made the first experience very welcoming . I had the pork Gyoza which was crispy on the bottom  delicious filling, and had a great sweet soy sauce on the side. I also had the Pork ramen bowl with added black garlic oil. I was not disappointed, Pork was juicey, broth was killer, and the noodles were prepared just right. It's a small and cozy place and I will be back!   P.S. I love when places give you a jug of water to pour myself

jhnJBtocOFLxH6KltBMscQ.text: My wife and I have been on a small ramen kick, trying everything in our general vicinity in midtown Phoenix. Nishikawa gets good reviews and is pretty close, so we gave it a try last night.  We had the vegetarian ramen, the spicy tuna appetizer and veggie spring rolls.  It was pretty busy for a Wednesday night, but we were seated immediately and the service was very good. The place has a distinct fast-food vibe; I don't mean that as a pejorative, it's just the way it is.  I don't know. I guess my overall assessment is ... OK. The food was clean and pretty fresh. It was just kind of blah. The veggie broth in the ramen literally tasted like what you'd buy at Sprouts. The noodles were good. The spring rolls were definitely frozen.  Again, it's fine. It's just not in the same category as, say, Cherry Blossom.

tCy0LFKANeox01KUbd3Thg.text: I like it and it's nice to have a noodle shop in the neighborhood. But, they are slow to deliver the food and I've had better elsewhere.

b6b7mUhz9d4nkFyU-Gkdsw.text: We've been looking for a good ramen bowl...we found an awesome ramen bowl here! Some of the best ramen I've had was in Los Angeles, and the ramen here is comparable. Staff was very accommodating and the restaurant was small but clean and comfortable. This restaurant was pleasing to myself, my fiance and my 13 year-old daughter. I'm also on a gyoza hunt...and these are in the top 3 that I've had. Great food!

IjlI4Bjr5MDyszdRNvJpyw.text: Really good ramen. I like how you can add additional items into your dish if you want. They give you plenty for the price. The restaurant is kind of small so if you come in and it's busy, you'll have to wait for a table depending on your group size. If your bigger than a group of 3-4 people, they have to get creative sometimes with the seating. They try to reserve the big table for the really big groups. Overall, the food is good and no complaints. Recommend to vegetarians looking for good Ramen.

gsEPkv25TRAQvxD8NGDpvQ.text: Tasty, good heat on the ramen without  overpowering of flavor.  Nailed the soft egg.  Would definitely come back.

Vnk-Z4YeKpXyJM8uepbYAA.text: I honestly don't even know where to begin..... we'll... her we go... every time I Yelp places i try to go in with high hopes... and this place sky rocketed into outer space! We had the Nishikawa Black soup the texture, noodles, thickness of soup.... flavors bursting in your mouth!!!OUTSTANDING!!! We also had the Katy's Bowl, which was very delicious!!! Super authentic! Super flavorful! I will definitely come here again... and I would recommend Nishikawa Ramen to friends, family even strangers!

fqRjwoASyrwuhcgHRUdPcw.text: What a great place! The food is delicious, decently priced, and the staff are kind. It was only a matter of minutes after we ordered our food that it was sent to our table. My kids even enjoyed their dinners!

geEoOuc6X0DAO8-2aaHGVA.text: The vegeterian and vegan miso is really good! Tons of flavor. The restuarant itself is pretty small so it can get crowded quickly, but you can order your food to go and they'll keep the broth seperate from the noodles so they don't get mushy! This location is still pending it's liquor application so not sure how prices on that will be yet. A good price for food based on the portion size.

Nzs9M9k6ypUXySRJPap3IQ.text: I got ramen from here and it was good but my experience was horrific. I called for an order for pick up and asked for a side of rice instead of noodles because I am gluten free for health reasons. They told me that they are not making any rice because they were closing early (I called an hour before the advertised closing time). I asked why they were closing early when picking up my order and they said because they "weren't busy" even though they had several pick up orders other than mine waiting...... Food was good but the customer service was a 1 out of 10 in every way. They were even talking negative about me while I was in the restaurant.

xs-ovMrUJi0wRg5w6NdqTQ.text: *4.50* Best ramen I've eaten in Phx so far. Started with some apps: chicken kara age, geso, and tako yaki. Kara age was nice and crispy, geso wasn't bad either, but compared to the motherland (Japan) would have preferred the thicker legs, tako yaki was as expected (we asked if they were freshly made the traditional way, but no). Still they were presented the traditional way and tasty. More importantly all the apps were served hot! The tonkotsu ramen was just a little to oily for my taste. Nonetheless still had bold deep flavor! Wife and my son had the black ramen, great flavor again!Daughter had the veggie ramen, soup was a little bland but hey it was veggie. Would I go back? You betcha!!! Thanks Nishikawa Ramen.

EDYDNquzhiHbN30ehxXd7w.text: The food is phenomenal! The space is a bit small. I don't think they took into account having a rush hour and where people would wait for a table. Our waiter took awhile to get to us and the food took even longer. It's definitely a cozy place for one or two. I don't see them accommodating large parties. As far as food, would 100% recommend.

9pFmpGRl-mW79OL6hqOgcg.text: We drove from Glendale to eat at this place. This place reminded me of some ramen shops in Cali. The ramen and takoyaki I ordered were phenomenal. Definitely will come back again.

pxPgggIGzT7wYUrZBiDt7w.text: Ramen was overpriced for how unflavored it was. More like over cooked sobs noodles than ramen noodles. What was really bad was the service. Waitress kept running off instead of talking to us. Asked about what drinks they had, she told us and then ran off without asking if we wanted any drinks. Very unusual.

0vA1eB8i35akNxM34giBpQ.text: We went there for date night and had the Nishikawa Black,Yokohama Style ramen and the pork gyoza. It was delicious! The serving size was huge and the flavors were great. Can't wait to try more items off their menu!

dXy0R99squn4L4LO0QSasQ.text: Nice and friendly staff, slightly small dining area but cozy. xZIx3DkZDXuOYIAj0DCLrg.text: This has now become my favorite ramen spot. Their curry ramen and miso ramen have so far been my favorites to choose between! 2XBF5OX6nG0aZuQCxwHSMQ.text: It is nice to have a ramen house in the neighborhood. The place is very clean, the servers are pleasant and know the menu. and the food is oishii-desu (DELICIOUS!!). Potions are nice on the rice bowls and appetizers, and large on the ramen bowls.

mnV--oIOwKMoLGo-f5jxag.text: The best Ramen we ever have!!! Love it!!!!!!!! Tasty soup, ramen and wonderful service!!!

w4stQS9u28DlkkOQFMI-sw.text: It may not be traditional but it's delicious. The Nishikawa Ramen is incredibly flavorful, full of a deep black garlic richness. The kicker for me is the smoked egg which might sound intimidating but is incredibly delicious
